SEARCH
Package photos.controllers

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
photos.controllers.UserController
public class UserController extends Object

The User Screen Controller

This class that is used to manage the User.fxml file, switch the stage to the User stage, handle button and text inputs, and manage the ListViews and ImageViews present in the current scene.
Since:
2022-11-29

      public void initialize() throws IOException
      This method initializes the observable list using the User object current.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • deleteAlbum

      public void deleteAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method deletes the selected item after receiving the action event. Disables the Album modification Buttons depending on the selected items available.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action event tied to the deleteAlbum Button.

    • albumButtons

      public void albumButtons(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method handles the disabling and re-enabling of Buttons.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The mouse event tied to the selection of the observable list.

    • albumNameChanged

      public void albumNameChanged(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      This method handles modifying an existing Album's name String. Handles disabling and re-enabling Button options.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - the event tied to the enterAlbum TextField.

    • createAlbum

      public void createAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method creates an Album object, and adds it to the current User. Depends on the value in the enterAlbum TextField.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action event tied to the createAlbum Button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • renameAlbum

      public void renameAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method renames the selected Album using the String stored in the enterAlbum TextField. Updates the observableList to reflect the changes.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action event tied to the renameAlbum Button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • openAlbum

      public void openAlbum(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method opens the Album selected in the albums ListView.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action event tied to the openAlbum Button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • conjunctiveSearch

      public void conjunctiveSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method performs a conjunctive search on the String in the searchPhotos TextField. It compares said String against the String tags stored in all stored Photos for the current User. Displays all photos containing both tag strings.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action event tied to the conjunctiveSearch Button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • disjunctiveSearch

      public void disjunctiveSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method performs a disjunctive search on the String in the searchPhotos TextField. It compares said String against the String tags stored in all stored Photos for the current User. Displays all photos containing either one or both of the two Strings in the ImageView.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action event tied to the disjunctiveSearch Button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • photoSearch

      public void photoSearch(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method enables the Photo search Buttons.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action event tied to the addTagSearch Button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • clearPhotoSearch

      public void clearPhotoSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Clears the search results from previous tag and date filters.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent tied to the clear Button.

    • checkTagsSingular

      public void checkTagsSingular(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method checks the singular tag String entered, and displays the photos containing it in the ImageView.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action event tied with the singularSearch Button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • checkDate

      public boolean checkDate(String[] date_full)
      This method checks if the previously split String is a valid date. The split String array will always be of length 3.
      Parameters:
      date_full - The String array of the entered date.
      Returns:
      True if date_full is a valid date, False if date_full is not a valid date.

    • displayDateAlert

      public void displayDateAlert()
      This method displays the Alert error for an incorrectly entered date String.

    • checkDateRange

      public void checkDateRange(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method checks if the date(s) in the searchPhotos TextField in String format is a valid date or not. If the date or range is valid, it displays the matching Photos in the ImageView.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • closeAndLogout

      public void closeAndLogout() throws IOException
      This method exits out to the Login Screen upon the selection of the LogoutB Button.
      Throws:
      IOException
